com.guidewire.external.entity
Class EntityMock

java.lang.Object
  com.guidewire.external.entity.EntityMock

public class EntityMock
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for generating a mock implementation of an external entity interface for testing. The mock is implemented with a proxy that implements any setter on the entity by storing the provided value and any getter by returning a previously stored value. By default it also provides a sensible implementation of equals(), hashcode() and toString().

After a mock is created, the caller may also add a delegate object. When a method is invoked on the mock, the proxy's invocation handler will first examine it's delegate objects to see if any of them declare a method with the same signature; if one does, the method will be invoked on the delegate. If it does not, the handler next checks to see if the method is equals(), hashcode(), or toString() and executes the default logic. Finally, it checks to see if the method is a getter or setter and handles those. If any other method is called (such as a domain method), the handler throws IllegalArgumentException.

The delegate allows the caller to override any method on the entity, as well as to decorate the entity with additional methods used for testing. When adding methods, the caller should extend the entity interface to add signatures for the new methods, and then implement those methods on the delegate object.

newEntityMock

public static KeyableEntity newEntityMock(java.lang.Class entityType)
Creates a new instance of the supplied entity interface.

Parameters:
entityType - The interface type to mock out.
Returns:
The mock instance implementing the interface.

setId

public static void setId(KeyableEntity entity,
                         int id)
Sets the id on the mock object by creating a new key with the specified id and setting it on the object.

Parameters:
entity - A mock created by newEntityMock(java.lang.Class)
id - The id value to set on the mock.

addDelegate

public static void addDelegate(KeyableEntity entity,
                               java.lang.Object delegate)
Add a delegate to an entity. Delegates are checked in the order in which they've been added, e.g. if the same method exists on two different delegates then the method will be invoked on the delegate registered first.

Parameters:
entity - Entity to which to add the delegate.
delegate - A delegate object that implements methods defined on the entityType interface. Any interface methods implemented by the delegate will be invoked reflectively to override default method handling behavior of the mock. Note that the delegate does not need to (and ordinarily will not) implement the entity interface.

removeDelegate

public static void removeDelegate(KeyableEntity entity,
                                  java.lang.Object delegate)
Remove an existing delegate from an entity.

Parameters:
entity - Entity from which to remove the delegate.
delegate - An existing delegate object for this entity.

initEntityFactory

public static void initEntityFactory()
Make the default EntityFactory (e.g. EntityFactory.getEntityFactory()) return entity mocks.
